elements.name: A POST request to the "/api/visitorsPurposeAdd" endpoint with valid authorization and correct data
elements.description:
should return a 200 status code, a response body with the message "Success," and the creation of the new visitor
  purpose record should be verified via a GET request to the "/api/visitorsPurposeId" endpoint using the "addId"
  from the response body.

steps.name: The api user sets "api/visitorsPurposeAdd" path parameters.
The api user prepares a POST request containing "deneme purpose" and "deneme description" information to send to the api visitorsPurposeAdd endpoint.
The api user sends a POST request and saves the returned response.
The api user verifies that the status code is 200.
The api user verifies that the "message" information in the response body is "Success".

name: As an administrator (admin) I want to be able to create a new visitor purpose record via API connection.

elements.name: Invalid Token When a GET request is sent to the /api/visitorsPurposeList endpoint with invalid authorization
elements.description:
information, it should be verified that the status code returned is 403 and the message in the response body is
  "You do not have authorization or token error.".

steps.name: The api user sets "api/visitorsPurposeList" path parameters.
The api user sends a GET request, saves the returned response, and verifies that the status code is '403' with the reason phrase Forbidden.

name: As an administrator (admin) I should be able to access the Visitor Purpose List via API connection.
